channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Sen. Dave McCormick and Dina McCormick, Who Believed in You?
channel.desc: Sen. Dave McCormick and his wife Dina McCormick discuss the importance of mentors and share stories of successful politicians and business leaders who have had their lives changed by them.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Stanley McChrystal, On Character - Choices That Define a Life
channel.desc: Retired General Stanley McChrystal talks about personal character - and the hallmarks of being our best selves as American citizens.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald, The Hand Behind Unmanned
channel.desc: Authors Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald discuss America's unmanned arsenal - from torpedoes to drones to automated technologies. Stanford University's Hoover Institution hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: University of Michigan law professor Leah Litman makes the case for why she believes the Supreme Court isn't making rulings based on legal principles.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Stanley McChrystal, On Character - Choices That Define a Life
channel.desc: Retired General Stanley McChrystal talks about personal character - and the hallmarks of being our best selves as American citizens.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald, The Hand Behind Unmanned
channel.desc: Authors Jacquelyn Schneider & Julia Macdonald discuss America's unmanned arsenal - from torpedoes to drones to automated technologies. Stanford University's Hoover Institution hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: After Words
channel.desc: University of Michigan law professor Leah Litman makes the case for why she believes the Supreme Court isn't making rulings based on legal principles.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Paul Hawken, Carbon - The Book of Life
channel.desc: Environmentalist and entrepreneur Paul Hawken charts the role of carbon on Earth as both the building block of all life and its role in climate change. The Commonwealth Club of California in San Francisco hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Thor Hanson, Close to Home - The Wonders of Nature Just Outside Your Door
channel.desc: Biologist Thor Hanson explains how nature exists not just in rural areas, but in cities and backyards. Town Hall Seattle hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Rich Benjamin, Talk to Me
channel.desc: Cultural anthropologist Rich Benjamin talks about his grandfather, Daniel Fignol, the former president of Haiti who was ousted in a coup in 1957, and his family's reluctance to acknowledge what happened to him.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Martin Reeves, Like - The Button That Changed the World
channel.desc: How did the Like button become so ubiquitous? Author Martin Reeves explores the origins of the thumbs-up symbol and how it's changed the internet; Planet Word Museum in Washington, D.C., hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 2 US
channel.title: Scott Bok, Surviving Wall Street
channel.desc: Greenhill & Co. CEO Scott Bok discusses his career on Wall Street and tenure as chairman of the board of trustees for the University of Pennsylvania during 2023, when it was accused of condoning antisemitism on campus.
